newsitem.title: FRANCE: Total says crude above $20 unsustainable.
newsitem.headline: Total says crude above $20 unsustainable.

text.p: Crude oil prices cannot remain above $20 a barrel over the long term, Total chairman Thierry Desmarest said on Wednesday.

The "current situation with Brent above $20 is not representative of a long-term trend," he told a news conference after Total reported a 45 percent increase in half-year net attributable profit to 2.63 billion francs.
In July and August, the average price of international benchmark Brent crude was $20 a barrel, compared with $19 a barrel in the first half.
Desmarest said, however, Total expected a sharp rise in its profits even if oil prices fell to $16 a barrel.
At 1019 GMT, October Brent was trading at $21.95 a barrel after hitting a post-Gulf War high of $23.50 a barrel in Asian trade Tuesday following the U.S. military strike against Iraq.
